Fields.DialogueText: Oh shoot fire, Cap! I lost the pearl from my locket!
Must I remind you again that it is Captain, not Cap?
Sorry, Cap... Captain. It's just that Narwhal gave it to me on my commission date.
I'm sorry, Nautilus, but we have more pressing things to worry about.
It sounds like the crew needs to get the iron on the stove... heh.

Fields.MenuText: Not another joke!
A smile, now that's the Nautilus I know.
Let's get back to work.

Fields.DialogueText: Get it? Pressing with an iron... heh.
It's not going to last for long without my pearl.
I'm too upset to work right now.
It must have been that blasted Confusion! I should have known when I got that nasty hit.
It sounds like we need to work on your defensive maneuvers.
I think I'd rather do some Morgana target practice, Cap!
Captain, Nautilus. It's Captain. And judging from that outline on the horizon, it looks as if you have more than just practice headed your way...
@BATTLE
Captain! I heard they have some lucky oysters where we're heading!
They also have a purple fog that we should be more concerned with.
Didya know that pearls are just grimy seafloor gunk that oysters turn into treasures?
Now is not the time for trivia, Nautilus.
I'm just thinking of what the pearls will look like when they get some Morgana guts to snack on... heh.

Fields.MenuText: They would probably end up radioactive.
I'm sure you wouldn't want one in your locket, kid.
If we don't get on course, you'll never find out.

Fields.DialogueText: We could use it as a lamp in the galley!
You're right... I'd rather have my old one back.
Aye, aye!
Well then, let's go make some Morgana meat pearls, Cap... Captain!
Go check our headings, Nautilus... we have a long journey ahead of us.
Oh no! I don't think we'll have to wait long...
Man your battle stations!
@BATTLE
How deep is the ocean? How high is the sky?
Nautilus... Nautilus!
Oh! What can I do ya for, Cap... Captain?
We've had reports from the fleet that there may be an imminent Morgana attack.
If I ever lost you, how much would I cry?

Fields.MenuText: It's time to focus, Nautilus.
You might find out if we don't do some recon.
You're a regular canary, kid.

Fields.DialogueText: Focused like a camera lens!
Okay... I'll ready the crew to get under way.
Golly... thank you!
St. Louis loaned me some of her new records. What a sweet patootie! Maybe when I find a new pearl, I can get her a matching one.
Maybe we can stop for you to go pearl diving at our next location.
Oh, that *would* be swell!
Well then, let's get under way.
@BATTLE
Look alive, Nautilus! Enemy inbound!
Quoi?
Huh?
@BATTLE
Bonjour, Capitaine! Un combat difficile, n'est ce pas?
French, Nautilus? I didn't realize you could speak other languages.
Ah nuts, Cap... Captain. Yeah, I picked it up more than once over the years - long story.
But when I read Monsieur Verne in his native language, I just start slipping back into it without thinking about it.
As long as you aren't planning to trade me in for Captain Nemo.
Vingt mille lieues sous les mers - Tour du monde sous-marin, Capitaine. Doesn't it sound so lovely in French?
When I saw my first Morganas, I couldn't help but think of old Aronnax spotting your fictional namesake.
Uh... uh... she reminded you of the Nautilus? What kind of baloney is that?
I just meant that it was like seeing what I thought was a natural sea creature and discovering it was some kind of mechanized beast.
Beast?! You can't call Nemo's Nautilus a beast! I think I'm gonna go back below deck and practice my French.
Please don't take offense, Nautilus. I didn't mean anything by it.
Je ne vous écoute pas...
Now, Nautilus. That isn't going to help anything.
Cela signifie que vous êtes un flat tire... CAP!
A whole lotta nasty comin' our way, Captain!
@BATTLE
Hey! Captain! Strike a post-battle pose!
*SNAP*
Looks like someone found their new camera. I'm sorry it's not a new pearl, but it is probably more valuable.
Golly gee, Captain! I love it – perfect for getting some new shots of those Morgana creeps!
Please don't drop it over the bow like your last camera, Nautilus.
It sure is snazzy, Cap! ... I mean, Captain. Time for a profile shot!
*SNAP*

Fields.MenuText: That is enough for now – time to get some recon shots.
Make sure to get my good side.
Maybe I should get you a camera strap so you don't drop it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm ready when you are, Captain!
You've got it!
That might be a good idea.
I'm gonna shoot those nasty beasts with my camera and with my deck guns! Snap and BANG!
Careful... you're getting too close to the railing!
Whoops... uh oh. Gotta scoot, Cap!
Nautilus... Nautilus?! Is that your camera sinking to the bottom?!
*SPLASH*
Has anyone seen Nautilus? She hasn't been on deck for a while. I'm starting to get worried about her.
Here I am.
Yuck! If you're going to shake off seaweed, do it below decks.
Golly, Cap... Captain. I didn't mean to make a mess. I was in the kelp bed looking for oysters. Wanna help me shuck some shells?

Fields.MenuText: Not right now - we have work to do.
Maybe we should wait until after this fog clears.
If you get some sailcloth to protect the deck, I'll help you.

Fields.DialogueText: All you ever think about is work.
That fog ruins all the fun!
That's keen, Captain! I'll grab 'em now!
Captain! I hear those blasted Morganas again! Jeepers, just the sound makes my skin crawl. I'm gonna blow them to bits this time!
Battle stations, everyone!
Let's fill 'er up with sunshine, Cap!
Captain, Nautilus. It's Captain.
@BATTLE
Nautilus, I have a very important, very dangerous mission for you.
I'm all otocysts, Cap... Captain!
All what?
It's what a Nautilus has for an ear. Get it? Like, I'm all ears. Heh...
No time for jokes, Nautilus. I just received a dispatch that some Morganas are prowling along the coast near us.
Well, hot dog! I'd like to introduce her to my deck guns, Captain.
You'll get your chance. We're hoping to get a sense of their mission out here - if mission is the right word for Morganas - but whatever it is we're not letting her complete it.
Incidentally, our superiors are hoping to get more photographic documentation of what we're dealing with out here... just if you get a chance.
But... my camera. Last time I saw it, it was hitched to the fin of a whale.
I got you a new one. With a strap this time. Remember, though, beating the enemy is a higher priority than recording her... be careful, Nautilus.
Aye, aye, Cap... Captain!
@BATTLE
Captain? I still have an uneasy feeling after our last encounter with the Morganas.
Tell me about it, Nautilus. I didn't see anything unusual in your report.
Well... I'm probably the sneakiest, quietest sub I know and I can swim up behind a sea urchin without it pulling its quills... but it's like they knew I was there.
Did they see you? Or make contact with you?
No, they didn't... but I could swear I heard someone say something to me.
It wouldn't be the first time you thought you heard a Morganas talking to you.
Correct. When I was hiding in the kelp bed, I saw tentacles flick ever so slightly and then I heard... or felt some thing say, "I know where to find Narwhal's pearl."
Are you sure, Nautilus? If they can communicate with you from a distance, this could be some very significant intelligence I need to pass on.
But... Captain? What if they really can help me find my pearl?
You need to get that out of your head, kid. If this is true, they are trying to manipulate you, to entice you.
You're right. Thanks for watchin' over me. Now, there are other Morganas headed this way - we ought to head out!
Thanks for the heads up, Nautilus.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant! Take the wheel for a moment. I need a word with Nautilus.
What's the story, morning glory?
It's still Captain, Nautilus. Do you still have those oysters? Let's get to shucking.
Well, ring a ding ding! You're the best Captain ever! I'll grab some knives from the galley!
Make sure to bring some sailcloth... these things are a mess.
Did you know that the finest pearls are found in the Sulu Archipelago of the Philippines? Someday I'd like to go free diving there.
Maybe we could...
*ALARM*
Get to your guns, Nautilus!
They must be ready for another helping of torpedo stew!
@BATTLE
MINE!
Where?! Nautilus, where are the mines?!
Oops! Sorry Cap... Captain. That pesky seagull was trying to get my treat.
You almost gave me a heart attack. What is that delicious smell?
It's a crab bake! I went diving and found these giant snacks just waiting for me. Yum!
Nautilus, please promise me you were not out searching for Morganas.
I wasn't exactly looking for any, Captain. Not exactly...
Now look, kid... it was a trick. You looking for them is exactly what they want. Trust me, it's not because they want you to find Narwhal's pearl... they want you!
I could fight them off, you know.

Fields.MenuText: I am sure you could, Nautilus.
I know - but I'd rather it be on our terms.
That is not part of the mission, Nautilus.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for believing in me, Captain.
If I'm chasing them, they are on my terms. Right?
Well, it should be!
The smoke from the crab bake is looking a bit odd...
That's no smoke!
@BATTLE
I saw an octopus dive for cover during that last battle. Have you ever seen how an octopus eats its prey?
I can't say that I have, Nautilus. Not from your point of view, anyway.
Well, while its prey is still alive, it will inject it with venom that paralyzes it. Then it rips it apart with its beak! While it's still alive, that is.
That sounds rather awful, Nautilus.
They will stalk their prey, Captain. Stalk, ambush, attack, and devour. *shivers*
You're thinking about that one Morgana, Asphyxiation, aren't you?
I heard that their favorite things to eat are mollusks. A nautilus is a mollusk, you see.

Fields.MenuText: Well, my Nautilus has guns and torpedoes. She's going to be just fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap... thanks, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't do so great in biology class.
We're not the prey. We're the hunters, Nautilus.

Fields.DialogueText: In war, we're all a little bit of both.
I'm glad Belles don't have to go to school...
*ALARM*
Shake it off. Put it out of your mind, and let's get the job done.
@BATTLE
What's eating ya, Captain?
I just received a dispatch that Confusion, Dismay, and some other Morganas have been sighted in nearby locations.
Well, I better get my guns loaded, Captain.
Considering the dispatch, I think we better load your torpedoes and dive.

Fields.MenuText: I have faith in you.
If Confusion is there, we'll get her this time.
We will have surprise on our side.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for the pep talk!
With your lead and my guns... they're toast!
Oh boy... they are all in for a big surprise!
DIVE!
We're submerged, Captain!
Nautilus, did you leave your new camera on the deck?
@BATTLE
Ah, Confusion! She's the one that can change her camouflage in the middle of a battle? It's so... so confusing.
Ugh! Not again!
Look, Captain! I got a postcard from Narwhal!
Any news of the Morganas?
There are a whole lot of lines blacked out, but it looks like she found a beautiful new dive spot!
Redacted, as usual. *sigh* I wish we could get some new intelligence out here.
She also says she's sending me some new shells for my hair.

Fields.MenuText: I am sure they will be lovely.
It is good to see a smile on your face.
Make sure you don't lose those, too.

Fields.DialogueText: I wonder what color they'll be...
We need a smile on your face too, Captain.
No need to be mean.
I've gotta find something nifty to send back to her...
What's wrong, Nautilus?
I've got the heebie-jeebies, Captain. ... Ah, horsefeathers. There are Morganas on the horizon.
@BATTLE
Look alive, folks! Morganas incoming!
Let's clear them out fast - I've got a full schedule today!
@BATTLE
It looks like Nautilus has disappeared again. Has anyone seen her since the battle?
She said she was going diving for oysters.
She told me that she was going on a reconnaissance mission.
Captain, I saw her in a hammock strung between the deck guns.
*yawn* Hiya, Cap... Captain!
Hiya? Nautilus, what have you been up to?
The ship's cook bet me that I couldn't outswim a pod of dolphins... I proved him wrong!

Fields.MenuText: You must be more careful with Morganas out there.
That's my girl!
I hope you won something good.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, applesauce... don't spoil all the fun.
Thank ya! It was super fun.
Oh, you bet I did!
Guess who won us two tins of sardines! Yum! I'll split it with you.
Those are all yours. See if you can win us some wine next time.
That's a good plan, Cap!
Captain, Nautilus. Captain *sigh*
Here we go again!
@BATTLE
Get a load of this! I gave my old shells to the local ladies and they made me a new bathing suit.
Haven't had a chance to try it on yet, but it's easy enough to imagine, right?
Oh... my.
Hopefully the torpedo damage won't show on my body.
I got the same report from the corpsman. Nautilus, you must be more careful.
I know, Captain! I was right in the middle of that one sortie and an awful Morgana snuck up behind me.

Fields.MenuText: We must be more prepared next time.
I hope that you are feeling up to another battle.
Remind me to thank those local ladies.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the plan!
I'm always up for another battle!
You're gonna make me blush!
I had them make something for you too, Captain.
Well, then... seashell cufflinks! These are lovely, Nautilus. I don't know what to say.
Aw shucks, Cap... Captain. It's the least I can do.
It's my duty. And my pleasure.
Enemies on the approach, Captain!
I can sense them...
I can feel her. She's just below us, but she hasn't popped up to make her attack yet.

Fields.MenuText: I've got your back, kid.
To your stations, everyone!

Fields.DialogueText: I've got your back too!
My torpedoes are loaded and ready!
What is the plan of engagement? Do we chance diving?
Get your deck guns ready for action!
I think... she... Captain! She's gone! I can't feel them below us anymore...
This is all very peculiar, but we still have an incoming attack!
Let's take those Morganas for a ride, Cap!
@BATTLE
What's going on here, Nautilus? You're making the entire crew seasick!
Oh! Hiya, Cap... Captain! The waves a little rough for ya?
Just a bit. Wait a minute... are we sailing in a pod of whales?
Yet bet! I got a dispatch from one of the Royal Navy subs that we could find some fine body surfing with the migrating whales out here. Wheeeeeeeee!

Fields.MenuText: Look out - I'm going to be sick again!
You've had your fun, but we need to get back to the deck.
The crew is going to be extra cranky with you.

Fields.DialogueText: Over the side of the deck, Captain!
What a killjoy! Okay... back to work.
Not when they see the fish the whales kicked up for chow!
Woo... that was the sardine's whiskers! There's nothing like body surfing with some new friends.
Where do you come up with those lines, kid?
You should join in next time! You'd be a lot less seasick off the ship and in the water.
Maybe next time we get shore leave. For now, it's back to work.
I'm holding you to it this time!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I just want to apologize again for the whale pod body surfing, Cap...
It's all right, Nautilus.
You've got to believe me, I had no idea my surfing...
Really, Nautilus, it's fine.
... would cause so many of our crew to lose their lunches.

Fields.MenuText: I assure you - all is forgiven.
In this instance, asking the crew to clean up after themselves seemed a bit harsh.
It's wasn't just their lunch.

Fields.DialogueText: Gosh, Cap, that's... really nice of you.
I tried to clean as much of it up myself as I could! Like I said, I really felt bad!
I know.
In the future, just try to remember that you have a human crew aboard your ship... and that those humans' stomachs aren't invincible.
You've got it, Cap!
*ALARM*
You ready?
Always.
@BATTLE
Glad you could make it, Cap... Captain. Fighting the Morgana wouldn't be the same without you!
@BATTLE
Captain! Captain! I got a dispatch from Surcouf after that last battle, and she said we're really close to a prime location for finding oysters!
People say Surcouf would be the one to know where treasure is hiding.
She says the oysters here are supposed to have amazing pearls... or should I say, perles magnifiques!
Ah, I see you have been studying your languages again, Nautilus.
Oui, Capitaine! Now, time to put on your maillot de bain so you can join me on my pearl hunt.

Fields.MenuText: I am not sure a pearl dive is a chance we should take right now.
I don't think the crew needs their captain in a bathing suit.
Maybe we should wait until things calm down.

Fields.DialogueText: Fiddlesticks! This'll be fun!
Don't worry about them! I need you in a bathing suit!
If we waited for that, we'd never have a chance to go!
Now, Nautilus... I would need to get my suit, my dive mask, tell the...
Oui, oui... tell the crew, grab your fins. Already done, Cap... Captain! All you need to do is get dressed and in the water!
I guess that settles it... let's go hunting for pearls.
Yay! You sure are the kipper's knickers, Captain!
Captain, how long do you think it would take for us to travel 20,000 leagues?
Well, that would be over 100,000 kilometers. If we're talking non-stop at your top surface speed, it would take us months. That doesn't account for refueling, or resupply, or...
Not at my surface speed. Submerged, like Captain Nemo and his Nautilus.
In that case, at the very least, you have the better part of a year ahead of you... again, without factoring in resupplies.
All in all, that's not too bad for traveling the entire world almost three times. Less than a year... hmmm.

Fields.MenuText: What plan are you hatching, Nautilus?
Maybe we can find out when the war is over, kid.
You would probably have to triple that time with all of your mid-mission distractions.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh nothing, Captain. Just daydreaming.
Wowie! Really, Cap? I mean, Captain.
Be fair now, Captain. I just keep things exciting!
We could travel the seas like Captain Nemo and his Nautilus!
Well, more like Professor Pierre Aronnax and Nautilus.
Do you hear something? It sounds like...
To your battle stations!
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap. Captain, I mean. Sorry to pull you away from the radio room, but we have callers.
Nasty ones.
@BATTLE
An invitation came in for you after the battle, Nautilus.
Oh boy! It's from USS Mississippi and HMS Shropshire! There is going to be an All Belle Games!
Well now, that sure sounds like fun. What types of sports are in an All Belle Games?
Looks like there will be open water sprints, distance dives, obstacle courses, potato sack races... you name it!

Fields.MenuText: It sounds like we're going to need to make room for a bunch of gold medals.
I know you'll make us proud.
It's time to get serious about your training.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit, Cap! I mean, Captain!
Thanks, Cap! I mean, Captain.
Every day is training day with you, Captain.
I hope that Belles from all of the nations will join in the games.
It will be a good way to build some bridges, wouldn't you say?
And how! Always the diplomat, Cap!
Captain, Nautilus. It's Captain.
Has anyone seen Nautilus? We're diving deep and she's gone again.
Captain, I believe that she is training for the All Belle Games.
*gasp* Phooey! Still only 90 meters! *gasp*
90 meters is a very solid depth, Nautilus.
But Captain, I've heard rumors that Belles from the Imperial Japanese Navy submarine squads can reach 100 meters! I can't win against them.

Fields.MenuText: I guess I shouldn't tell you that reports on the Kriegsmarine U-Boat Belles say they are hitting 200 meters.
None of them have your style, kid.
As long as you can dive out of depth charge range, you're good.

Fields.DialogueText: 200 meters?! I need to get back to training!
Thanks, Captain. You're a sweetie!
That's not going to help me in the Games!
Maybe if I lose some gear or change the pressure in my tanks...
Don't lose focus, Nautilus. Our first concern is not the Games...
Uh-oh... I think my diving might have brought the attention of those nasty Morganas.
Sound the alarms!
@BATTLE
Nautilus, you still seemed bothered by our latest battle.
I'm sorry, Captain. I just can't get the words out of my mind. It's like those tentacles are wrapped around my brain.
No need to apologize. We need to focus on defeating them.
It's just... well, what if they really know where I can find Narwhal's pearl? I mean...

Fields.MenuText: Even if they do, it's going to be a trap.
Would you feel better if we went on another pearl dive?
That's not a chance I'm willing to take. You're far too important, Nautilus.

Fields.DialogueText: Trap or not, I'll be prepared.
I might.
I think I'm gonna blush...
Why don't we grab our bathing suits and dive for some crabs?
Yes, yes! That sounds like a great way to take my mind off silly mechanical octopuses.
Maybe we'll stumble on some oysters too.
@BATTLE
We've stumbled onto something else, Cap... er, Captain!
*ALARM*
*gasp* Hiya, Cap... Captain!
What on earth are those, Nautilus?
Oh these? These are bags.
I am aware of that. What are they for?
For potatoes, Captain.
And why do you have potato bags, Nautilus?
Oh! We're practicing for the All Belle Games potato sack races.

Fields.MenuText: Is the whole crew out here?
Be careful you don't fall off the deck.
Don't think of asking me to join in.

Fields.DialogueText: No silly! We left one officer at the helm.
Been there, done that.
I wouldn't want you to feel bad when I beat you.
I see. Well, don't keep the crew too long. There have been sightings of Morgana ships close to our location.
Now that you mention it... they might be a little too close for comfort.
@BATTLE
Here they come. Make sure the crew isn't playing around and gets to their battle stations!
We'll have all those cats out of the bags, Captain! Ha!
Nautilus, I have a special gift for you.
Another mission, Captain?
Nope... here you go.
A present? Golly, what beautiful wrapping!
Open it up...
A PEARL! Oh, Captain! It's amazing!
Just like you, Nautilus. Will it fit your locket?
Oh, yes! Merci beaucoup, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Ah, horsefeathers. You can call me Cap.
You know, Nautilus... we're close enough. Cap is fine.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll see about that... I've gotten pretty used to calling you Cap... Captain!
Aw, shucks, Cap. Thanks.
Happy with your present?
My eyes are watering at how beautiful it is...
